and regrets about the most derided Pentagon tenure since Robert McNamara 's day. On the fundamental question of his tenure, Donald Rumsfeld writes that invading Iraq was not a mistake, on the grounds that the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today were Saddam Hussein still in power. Schmidts allegedly arranged for less exercise equipment than was paid for to be delivered to Iraq. Eric Schmidt , who was deployed to Iraq in 2008, received bribes from Iraqi vendors, according to court documents. The Schmidts defrauded U.S. taxpayers, cheated the Iraqi people and betrayed the trust placed in them, said Stuart Bowen , special inspector general for Iraq Reconstruction.
